The Nifty Futures on the Singapore Exchange, an early indicator of Nifty’s performance in India, declined 0.3 percent to 8,494.





Your Friday morning briefingRead| https://t.co/reitT2y8Gw pic.twitter.com/Kg32BlVc3v— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) November 4, 2016






Here are the stocks to watch out for in today’s sessionBharti Airtel: Unit to get around $129 million from Zain for settling disputesBiocon: EMA to review Mylan’s submission for insulinCity Union Bank: 5.2 million shares traded in 8 blocks after marketHDFC: Cuts home loan rates by up to 15 basis pointsInterGlobe Aviation: Air Lease has seen some engine issues with IndigoMulti Commodity Exchange: Plans to start commodity options trade in goldONGC: Venezuela, India’s ONGC to sign oil output deal, says governmentTata Motors: Signs accord with Indonesia’s PindadWipro: Appoints Gilles Grange as regional head of France operationsParsvnath Developers incorporates unit Vasavi PDL VenturesTube Investments of India: Manufacturing business to be demerged into Ti Financial Holdings





Government to start exiting Larsen & Toubro stake after 13 years.@sajeetkm reportshttps://t.co/AW1RswcsyZ— BloombergQuint (@BloombergQuint) November 4, 2016
title: Stocks To Watch: Berger Paints, Titan, ONGC, Ashok Leyland And More
